item.title: 英国房屋建筑商股价因购房援助计划传闻大涨
item.description: 英国住房建设商股价上涨，此前有报道称政府正考虑推出新版已终止的"购房援助计划"。【原文：UK homebuilder stocks rose after a report saying the government is weighing introducing a new version of the discontinued Help to Buy program.】

item.title: 英国碳价暴跌，政治动荡加剧与欧盟基准价差
item.description: 英国碳期货价格暴跌，与欧盟基准价的价差扩大至数月来最大水平，政治不确定性和货币疲软令市场承压。【原文：UK carbon futures tumbled, driving the gap with the European Union benchmark to its widest in months as political uncertainty and currency weakness weighed on the market.】

item.title: 谷歌在搜索和Gemini聊天机器人中推出AI购物功能
item.description: 谷歌正在推出一项功能，让消费者在搜索引擎和Gemini聊天机器人中寻求人工智能驱动的答案时也能购物——这是该公司计划通过消费者的人工智能使用直接创收的一部分。【原文：Google is adding a way for consumers to buy things while seeking artificial intelligence-powered answers on search and in its Gemini chatbot — part of a plan to make money more directly from consumers’ AI use.】

item.title: 就业数据意外强劲，美联储降息之路面临挑战
item.description: 1月份就业数据意外强劲，降低了美联储在年中前再次降息的可能性，因为劳动力市场走势中最令人担忧的风险似乎已渐行渐远。【原文：Unexpectedly strong employment data for January reduces the chances the Federal Reserve will see a need to cut interest rates again by midyear as the most concerning possibilities for the trajectory of the labor market seem more remote.】

item.title: 美联储施密德称需维持限制性利率以抑制通胀
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行行长杰夫·施密德表示，美国央行应将利率维持在"略显限制性"的水平，同时他持续对通胀率居高不下表示担忧。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City President Jeff Schmid said the US central bank should hold rates at a “somewhat restrictive” level, as he expressed continued concerns over inflation that remains too high.】

item.title: 华尔街奖金助纽约市缩小50亿美元预算缺口
item.description: 据市长佐兰·曼达尼称，华尔街的奖金加上一项激进的储蓄计划，已使纽约市预计的两年预算缺口缩小了约50亿美元。【原文：Wall Street bonuses, along with an aggressive savings plan, has helped shrink New York City’s expected two-year budget gap by roughly $5 billion, according to Mayor Zohran Mamdani.】

item.title: 俄企争抢战争重压下的国家援助
item.description: 随着克里姆林宫因乌克兰战争面临不断扩大的预算赤字，越来越多的俄罗斯企业正排队申请国家援助和税收减免。【原文：A growing number of Russian companies are lining up for state aid and tax relief, just as the Kremlin is wrestling with a widening budget deficit from its war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 国会预算办公室因特朗普政策将美国赤字预测上调1.4万亿美元
item.description: 美国国会预算办公室周三再度警告称，美国财政状况正走向不可持续的道路，并将其对未来十年赤字的预测上调了1.4万亿美元——部分原因在于特朗普总统2025年税法及移民政策的影响。【原文：The Congressional Budget Office on Wednesday warned yet again that the US is on an unsustainable fiscal path, jacking up its estimate of deficits for the coming decade by $1.4 trillion thanks in part to President Donald Trump’s 2025 tax law and immigration policies.】

item.title: 强劲就业数据缓解消费者担忧，标普500指数直指历史新高
item.description: 周三美国股市上涨，交易员们对强于预期的就业报告表示欢迎。【原文：US stocks rallied on Wednesday as traders cheered a stronger-than-expected jobs report.】

item.title: 德意志交易所称并购活动未能推动欧盟市场发展
item.description: 德意志交易所集团一位高管表示，欧盟推动资本市场深化发展的举措，不应仅限于讨论交易所潜在的合并事宜。【原文：The European Union’s drive for deeper capital markets needs to look beyond discussions of potential mergers between exchanges, said a top Deutsche Boerse AG executive.】

item.title: 加密货币亿万富翁趁比特币暴跌50%抄底
item.description: 瓦尔·瓦维洛夫是加密货币的早期采用者，他通过设计比特币挖矿硬件，在15年间将Bitfury打造成为业内最具影响力的企业之一。【原文：Val Vavilov was an early cryptocurrency adopter who built Bitfury over 15 years into one of the biggest players in the industry by designing hardware to mine Bitcoin.】

item.title: 农民与拖拉机齐聚马德里 抗议欧盟-南方共同市场贸易协定
item.description: 周三，数千名农民涌入马德里市中心，抗议欧盟的农业政策以及欧盟与南美国家集团签署的自由贸易协定。【原文：Thousands of farmers marched into central Madrid on Wednesday to protest against European Union’s agricultural policies and a free trade agreement with a group of South American nations.】

item.title: 比特币24小时交易风险飙升，华尔街沉睡时
item.description: 比特币持续数月的下跌掩盖了其全天候市场核心的变化：交易永不停歇，但稳定价格的流动性仍遵循美国市场交易时段。【原文：Bitcoin’s months-long slide has masked a change at the heart of its 24/7 market: trading never stops, but the liquidity that steadies prices still follows US market hours.】

item.title: 雷森公司对债务重组计划保持沉默，其股价暴跌导致标普罕见下调评级7级
item.description: 雷森公司（Raízen SA）的表态出现转变——从公开讨论筹集新资金到不排除就潜在债务重组进行谈判的可能性——这促使标普全球评级将其信用评级下调七级，这是巴西企业有史以来遭遇的最大幅度的评级下调之一。【原文：A shift in tone from Raízen SA — from publicly discussing raising fresh capital to declining to rule out talks on a potential debt restructuring — contributed to S&P Global Ratings’ seven-notch credit downgrade of its credit score, among the largest ever for a Brazilian company.】

item.title: 美国劳动力市场数据强劲，美联储降息预期重置，国债价格暴跌
item.description: 美国就业数据强于预期，促使交易员下调对美联储今年降息的预期，国债价格应声下跌。【原文：Treasuries slumped after stronger-than-expected US employment data prompted traders to pare their expectations for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year.】

item.title: 美国非农就业人数增加13万，失业率意外下降
item.description: 美国1月就业数据超出预期，失业率意外下降，表明年初劳动力市场持续趋稳。【原文：US hiring beat forecasts in January and the unemployment rate unexpectedly fell, suggesting the labor market continued to stabilize at the start of the year.】

item.title: 托马斯·布拉沃与Vista试图平息对人工智能威胁软件行业的担忧
item.description: 私募股权软件专家托马斯·布拉沃和维斯塔股权合伙公司正紧急向基金投资者保证其投资组合状况良好。此前因对人工智能颠覆性影响的担忧引发上周股市大范围抛售。【原文：Private equity software specialists Thoma Bravo and Vista Equity Partners are rushing to reassure fund investors that their portfolios are healthy after anxiety over artificial intelligence disruptions sparked a broad equity selloff last week.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚总统候选人欲致电国际货币基金组织寻求援助以摆脱财政困境
item.description: 哥伦比亚财政赤字如此严重，以至于需要国际货币基金组织制定计划来帮助其恢复控制，该国即将举行的总统选举中一位中间偏右的候选人如是说。【原文：Colombia’s fiscal hole is so deep that it warrants an International Monetary Fund program to get it back under control, according to a center-right candidate in the country’s upcoming presidential election.】

item.title: 欧佩克称上月原油产量下滑，哈萨克斯坦产量骤降
item.description: 欧佩克+组织表示，由于哈萨克斯坦、委内瑞拉和伊朗的产量下降，该组织上月石油产量大幅下滑。【原文：OPEC+ oil production declined sharply last month amid losses in Kazakhstan, Venezuela and Iran, the group said.】

item.description: 英国能源巨头面临实现业务转型的压力。【原文：The UK energy giant faces pressure to deliver on its turnaround.】

item.title: 可可贸易商暂停科特迪瓦采购以寻求更低价格
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在最大可可生产国科特迪瓦，可可贸易商正推迟采购即将收获的中季作物，因市场暴跌后他们寻求更低价格。【原文：Cocoa traders in top grower Ivory Coast are holding off buying beans that will be harvested from the upcoming mid-crop, as they seek lower prices following a market rout, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 德国联邦银行行长纳格尔呼吁建立欧盟共同债务，Politico报道
item.description: 德国联邦银行行长约阿希姆·纳格尔支持增加欧盟共同债务，以提升该地区对投资者的吸引力。【原文：Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel backed more joint European Union debt to increase the region’s appeal to investors.】

item.title: 英国数百个清洁能源项目面临电网接入新延迟
item.description: 英国电网运营商将重置多达210个风能、太阳能及电池项目的进度表，承认无法满足被视为政府2030年清洁能源目标关键节点的时间要求。【原文：Britain’s grid operator will reset the timetable for as many as 210 wind, solar and battery projects, conceding it cannot meet deadlines seen as critical for the government’s 2030 clean power target.】

item.title: 第二家企业因爱泼斯坦档案暂停与迪拜环球港务集团的交易
item.description: 英国政府旗下拥有99亿英镑（136亿美元）资产的开发性金融机构英国国际投资公司，因港口运营商迪拜环球港务集团首席执行官与遭罢黜的金融家杰弗里·爱泼斯坦存在关联的指控，已暂停对该集团的投资。【原文：British International Investment, a £9.9 billion ($13.6 billion) development-finance institution owned by the UK government, halted investments with DP World over alleged ties between the port operator’s chief executive officer and disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.】

item.title: T-Mobile新增用户数低于预期，CEO面临考验
item.description: T-Mobile美国公司第四季度新增手机用户数低于分析师预期，凸显了新任首席执行官斯里尼·戈帕兰面临的挑战。【原文：T-Mobile US Inc. added fewer mobile-phone subscribers than analysts expected in the fourth quarter, highlighting the challenge ahead for new Chief Executive Officer Srini Gopalan.】

item.title: 尼日利亚开放官方美元市场予外汇兑换机构，以缩小奈拉街头汇率差距
item.description: 尼日利亚中央银行首次允许货币兑换机构在官方市场获取美元，旨在缓解零售市场美元短缺问题，并缩小奈拉官方汇率与黑市汇率之间的差距。【原文：The Central Bank of Nigeria has for the first time granted currency-exchange bureaux access to dollars at the official market, seeking to ease retail shortages and narrow the gap between the naira’s formal and street rates.】

item.title: Shopify股价盘前大涨，因营收超预期
item.description: Shopify公司第四季度业绩超出分析师预期，假日消费旺季推动营收增长。该公司股价在盘前交易中大幅上涨。【原文：Shopify Inc. beat analysts’ fourth-quarter estimates after strong holiday spending lifted revenues. The stock soared in premarket trading.】
